text:
Hi, first, kudos to Franklin :tada:.

I want to use it to deploy two websites, one related to a project (GitHub organisation) using the `<http://orgname.github.io|orgname.github.io>` landing page and one related to a teaching where a `<http://orgname.github.io/myWebsite/|orgname.github.io/myWebsite/>` landing would be preferred.

I followed the workflow described at <https://franklinjl.org/workflow/#creating_your_website> using the `basic` theme. I modified some pages and kept a minimal layout. The `serve()` produces expected output locally and all seems to be fine.

However, my deploy fails on GitHub while following the suggested steps (<https://franklinjl.org/workflow/deploy/#deploying_on_github>). My local folder’s content is indeed mirrored on my `<http://orgname.github.io|orgname.github.io>` repo and the green tick shows up after some 20 seconds. It however looks like the `__site/` folder does not make it to the `gh-pages` branch, the latter not being created “automatically” by the GitHub workflow (as expected?). Do I miss something obvious ? Looks like I do not have `.github/workflows` in the repo and my only branch is `main` not `master`.

Any help and suggestions welcome. The repo is accessible here <https://github.com/PTsolvers/PTsolvers.github.io>

In a second stage, once this above works, I would be interested to know if there is anything else I should pay attention at if making a website for the `<http://orgname.github.io/myWebsite/|orgname.github.io/myWebsite/>` configuration.

text: Sorry for bothering, I could fix the issue. I added the `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` file and it did the trick. I figured out I did a wrong copying action where I lost all hidden files…
